She has 7 apples more than her roommate. Penelope's roommate has 8 red apples. How many blue apples does the roommate have altogether?" Choices: A: 3 B: 4 C: 7 D: 8<n><n>```<n><n>### Demostration:<n>```<n>-Input: "Penelope has two pairs of shoes. She has two red shoes, and two blue shoes. She has six different shoes in all." Choices: A: false B: true<n>``` <n><n>### Example Input: "Warne has 3 more red flowers than blue flowers. He has 15 flowers in total.<n><n>How many blue and how many red flowers does Warne have?"<n><n><n>### Correct Answer<n><n>```<n>Answer:<n><n>```<n>### Answer<n>```<n>5 red flowers, 10 blue<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:The person is laying on the beach, why would he do that? Choices:  A: sun himself B: thank god C: race against time D: express love E: to think about things.<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>This is E: to think about.<n><n>### Input 2:<n>She is a very busy person. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:A common saying, Sam thought, was to go forth, also this. Choices:  A: reverse B: backwards C: back and D: back and E: tally back<n><n>### Response:		B) Incorrect:<n><n>### Demand:<n>In order to evaluate it, you must demonstrate your understanding of variables, functions, and operators.<n><n>### Description of Demand:<n>The goal of the demand is to give you practice with conditional expressions and if/then statements by requiring you to find a condition that will give the result you're looking for based on certain given conditions. <n><n>### Solution:<n>A common saying, Sam thinks, is to go forth, also backwards and back and forth. So,<n>```<n>(condition a) then (condition b) and (condition c)<n>```<n>```<n>(condition d) or (condition e)<n>```<n>### Response:<n>You will solve the above problem by writing a code where<n>you can create and evaluate a condition that matches the <n>provided conditions and evaluate it.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon. Choices:  A: to be heard B: receive gifts C: understand themselves D: good things in life E: acknowledgment<n><n>### Response:		C is the only answer that directly states that the counselor is going to help the individual. A B and E states that the counseling is something that the individual is trying to achieve. D is vague and does not specifically mention why the individual is seeking counseling.<n><n>### Input:'B' is the only incorrect word choice.<n><n>### Response:'B' is a verb and cannot be used as a word choice.<n><n><n><n>### **Task:Input:What are the steps for making a good decision about who should become a judge? Choices: 1.  Understand why you want to become a judge 2.  Have a good attitude 3.  Be able to explain why you want to become judge 4.  Be able to accept the limitations of being a judge 5.  Accept that some people will have issues 6.  Have a firm understanding of the law 7.  Be aware of public opinion 8.  Take criticism constructively 9.  Understand the limits to the power granted by the people 10. Avoid pre-judging people who are accused Expand:A is the attitude of wanting to help people B is taking things to heart C is understanding how decisions impact people D is being firm and just and E is accepting not everything will go the way a judge wants F is maintaining a good attitude G is understanding the laws are limited and can't always be followed H is accepting feedback in a constructive manner I is understanding the limits to be just a representative J is not taking things personally when faced with unfair accusations K is not pre-judging people <n><n>### Response:(1)A is the correct answer, but there is no context in the question for determining its value. The answer does not directly refer to the question without context (2)A and A are correct, but B is incorrect. (3)A, B, and B are correct. I.A, I, and I are incorrect because the question is ambiguous without context. H is incorrect.(J-L) are incorrect.( 4)E is incorrect because the answer is not directly associated with the question.<n><n>## Output<n>### Input:Write a comment that explains the following code:     for(i=0;i<=num;i++){    int temp=arr[i];    arr[i]=arr[num];    arr[num]=temp

The word “MATRIPOLI” consists of letters “MATRIPO”. The word “MADRID” consists of letters “MADRID”. A new word is formed by rearranging the given letters (TRIPLE to MATRIPOLIMATRIPOLIMADRI) in the given words, one by one. How many different new words can be formed?<n>### Response:A- Answer: 35MATRIPOLIM<n><n>## **Problem Solving, Task 2<n><n>Following is a task request for you to respond to. You are to solve the task the best you can. You are to create both a written and spoken solution.  <n><n>### Instructions:<n>What will you take with you on a trip to your great aunt's?<n><n>### Written Response:<n>* The best way to solve our daily problems is to listen to everyone. A problem can be defined as a situation that causes discomfort or disturbance and this goes to show that we are more concerned about our issues and often neglect to see the side of other people's problems. If everyone comes for the solution to a problem, then it will be easier to solve our issues as a collective unit as compared to if we continue to fight over our individual problems without considering the other people affected. The best way to solve a problem is to focus on what everyone wants so as to get things done in a group and everyone will be able to contribute.<n><n>### Spoken Response:<n>* The  solution for a problem is to hear everybody out what to say. A problem can be define as a condition that makes you uncomfortable or disturbance, which mean problem is more individual than collective. The best way to address your daily problem is listen to everyones views and suggestion. It is better to deal it together and help each other as the solution can not solve just by one person.<n><n>  <n><n><n><n>

He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:They wanted to eat at home but the cupboards were barren, so they had to go what? Penelope has 1 hat and 1 mitten. <n><n>Correct. Penelope has a mitten and a headwear item, but not a hat. This makes us unable to know whether to count as one or two, and this answers the question with an incorrect statement of the quantity.<n><n>### Sample Instruction<n><n>A gentleman is wealthy and flaunks it where does he likely lie?<n><n>### Conceptual Question<n><n>Suppose Penelope did not have one, and she borrowed one. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where can someone view a county highway as a line? Choices:  A: from the sky B: map C: cross counties by car D: country E: michigan<n><n>### Response:		Choice B is correct.<n><n>### Explanation: If from the sky, I have to assume you live a helicopter.<n><n>### Input (if needed):What can someone do to increase the number of calories burned while exercising? Choices: A: move your feet faster B: move their arms faster C: move higher D: play harder E: eat more<n><n>### Response (if needed):<n><n>### Examples: If one has a carpet that had a height of 1.5 meters and a width of 10 meters. How tall is the carpet if the carpet is 2 meters long?<n><n>### Input 2: If a piece of paper has 3.6 inches of thickness and 9.5 miles high. If the paper is 7 feet tall and 6 feet wide, how many feet in the paper?<n><n>### Expected:26.5 feet.<n><n>### Answer:27 feet.

What is the output of the program?<n><n>> 20<n><n>### Input:- Write a program to find the number of pairs of digits that contain the numbers in a string.<n>> Enter the string 'abcd': the output will be '2'<n><n>### Input, Instruction:Write a one-line program to reverse a String.<n><n>```javascript<n>let string1 = "Hello";<n>let string2 = "Hello";<n>console.log(string1.split("").reverse().join(""));<n>console.log(String2.split("").reverse());<n>// "Hell"<n>```<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>```javascript<n>```<n>

If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What is another term for instituting civil action? Choices:  A: confusion B: complications C: riot D: arrest E: protests<n><n>### Response:		<n>Confusion<n><n>### Response Explanation.<n>The word Confusion means a very high state of disorder, incapable of functioning. To institute implies bringing in and initiating something.<n><n><n>### Input A & Response:<n>What is another term for civil action?<n><n>### Input B & Response:<n>A: confusion<n><n>### Response Feedback:<n>* A is correct, but it needs much more detail .<n>* B is incorrect with the word incapable of function because the subject is civil, and we never discuss action as a noun.<n><n>### Input C & Response:<n>B: complications<n><n>### Response Review: <n>A complication is a detail that is involved in a plan. Because complications involve something that isn't a part of a plan, that doesn't mean that civil action is confused with complications.<n><n>### Response D & Feedback:<n>C is correct.<n><n>### Feedback:<n>That is why the term confusion is correct.<n><n><n>## Output:<n>The following is a task that provides some sample data.<n><n>### Task:<n>You might like to use the following data to write an appropriate response.<n><n>### Data:<n>- 1: John has 29 apples plus 17 more apples than Betty. John 29 apples. Betty has 3 less apples than John. How many apples does Bethy have?<n>- 2: In a classroom in a secondary school, there are 4 more pigeons than birds. There are 3 times more birds than pigeons in all. If the total number of birds is 1010, how many pigeons are there in the classroom?<n>- 3: A person weighs 100 pounds plus 13 pounds for each foot, plus 10 more pounds. This person's grandmother weighs 88 pounds less than the person weighed when the person was 10 years old. How much does the person 12 years old 2 pounds after the person has weighed?<n>- 4: When Jim bought a house, he paid 50% of the price of the house. He sold his old house for $10 more than the original price. He kept $20 for his time

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where do most people keep their curling iron stored? Choices:  A: bathroom B: walkway C: use D: hair salon E: drawer<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* A: bathroom<n>  * A bathroom is a logical choice for a curling iron because one might think that the room would be dry. Hygienic conditions would be suitable too.<n>* B: walkway<n>  * Walkways receive a great deal of foot traffic and have a moderate chance of water and dust entering. A walkway might not be the ideal place to keep curling irons, as the curling irons may get stepped on accidentally.<n>* C: use<n>  * Use is selected as the best option since this is where curling irons are usually used.<n>* D: hair salon<n>  * A hair salon could be an ideal place to keep curly irons. They are used often and hair salons are dry and sanitary. Curling irons could also be at risk of getting stepped on accidentally inside of the hair salon.<n>* E: drawer<n>  * A drawer would be an ideal place, but one would be careful about stepping on a curling iron, especially if it is on the bottom of the drawer. Besides, curling irons are fragile and could get broken if they get stepped on or mishandled inadvertently.<n><n>### Input::What are four things that a computer does best compared to a person?<n><n>### Response::A computer does not get tired like a person does, since it does not require sleep or rest. It never gets sick either, since it does not have a digestive system to process food. Computers are also able to perform more tasks faster than a person. They are also able to perform a task more accurately.<n>

He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. Choices:  A: then have B: headaches C: stoic D: being happy E: wanting more<n><n>### Response:		<n>   ![image](https://github.com/lhunt14/code-jupyter-demo-exercises-files/blob/main/1%20A%20B%20C%20D%20E.png)<n><n>###  Instruction：<n><n>Write the code which would allow us to find the largest digit in a given digit string (which can be a number or an integer).<n>In addition, print the remaining digits' sum as well. <n><n>###  Response:<n>The user enters a digit string. The code uses a for loop to walk through all the digits, and at each digit, it sums all the digits that are not the current one. At the end of the for loop, it calculates the difference of the sum and the value 0.<n>This difference is the value of the largest digit in the given string. It also tells us how many digits that we will have in case we were to add this value to our existing total sum.<n><n>###  Input:<n><n>![image](https://github/com/lhunt/code-jupiter-demo-exercizes-files/blob/master/string_digits.png)<n><n>Note that the 7 in position is the largest in this case.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>![image-20220208162404521](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84655142/152934049-74f4191c-7829-445d-b773-4e805e539d24.png)<n><n>The sum of remaining digits is 4 (82-00).<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a Python program using the for loop to find the largest digit string in a given number:<n><n>### Output example (using 404 as example):<n>The output is the largest digit string in `404`. <n><n>The for loop iterates over `404` and calculates the sum of digits for each iteration.<n><n>The largest digit string is `4`. <n><n>To print it, the program subtracts the largest digit string from the input number.<n>

In your response, use the same word sequence as the question, but use logic to support your answer.<n><n>Use any programing languages you want! To see instructions and examples of the format use the instructions and example prompt provided to you.  <n>In this prompt, you have a sentence with choices A-E. There are prompts with multiple choice with all the letters and some with only one or two letters. You should respond to what the question asked in a logical sense using your knowledge without copying the responses exactly as the question or the choices.<n><n>### Sample questions:  <n><n>#### Example:<n>Write a response that appropriately continues the conversation. In this prompt, you are writing a response that appropriately responds to your question regarding the location of many offices in New York. In your response, the first letter in your response must be 'a.' Then you respond in a logical manner.<n><n>### Input A:<n>Where is an office building? Choices: A: school building B C: skyscraber D: business E grocery store.<n><n>### Response A:<n>A: A is an office building. There are many of them in Queens New York, in fact you can see one on the horizon from Brooklyn.<n><n>### Example Response: You may think the answer is 'a' and in many way it is, you will respond to the first letter in your sentence. You may find that you are confused as to how to word your response. You don't have to use a word from the choices and often it isn't appropriate or helpful. You will use words such as 'It's' or 'It is' a lot, just in different ways to match your response and keep in line with the question.  <n><n>Input: You are getting to know a teacher. He teaches Spanish. The school bell goes at 3:40 pm.<n><n>### Choices<n>* A: 3:40 B: 3:43<n><n>### Response<n><n>Response: 3:41, he gets out of class 1 minute late.<n><n>### Questions

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:James was looking for a place to buy bitcoins.  He searched and found a large menu of what? Choices:  A: advertisement B: news C: bar D: cafe E: internet sites<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: A: Bar<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Input for Part 1:<n><n>### Response for Part 1:  <n><n>##<n>### Part 2 Instructions:<n>### Demonsturation:<n><n>### Output for Part 2:<n><n>### Question:Is the input (Part 1) and the output (Part 2) correct?<n>### Demostración:<n><n>### Is the input (Part 3) and the output (part 4) correct?<n>##<n>### Question:<n><n>### Answers:<n><n>### If the answer were incorrect, comment the steps that you would need to do to make it correct.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where can you store a small notepad on your person? Choices:  A: back pocket B: meeting C: drug store D: home E: school<n><n>### Response:		<n>I think it is safe and more convenient to put a small notepad in back pocket.<n><n>### Input 2: Which is easier to carry, a 3 pound bag of dirt or a 3 pound carrot?<n><n>### Response 2: I think a 3 pound of carrot is easier to carry than 3 pound of dirt because carrots are light, and dirt is heavy.<n><n>### Question 3:  Would you rather wash seven pots and skillets or wash only one by hand with soap and warm water? What about a dishwasher at a restaurant?<n><n>### Question#4:  What is the largest number you have ever received as your grade on a school assignment? Are there more whole numbers than real whole numbers?<n><n>### Instructions 4: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Instruct 5:  If a box contains 5 balls, and you have 25 balls, what is the smallest number of draws you need from the box to be sure that at least 2 of those balls are green?<n><n>### Demostration 6: <n><n>### Instuctions 6: Use the information provided to answer the following question.<n><n>## Solution<n><n>> To solve the multiple choice one is only required to read question and choose the appropriate response.<n><n>

Choices:  A: erections B: entertainment C: boredom D: get fat E: sadness<n><n>### Response:		I will get all of the choices that the question was looking to for except A, because I'm <n>watching t.v. and that would cause me to get erections. But I do not have a choice that would allow for an erection<n>because I'm watching tv and I don't really know how to get an erection  so if the choice of B or C are used correctly I<n>will get no erection but I will get entertained and not bored.<n><n>### Input 2<n>Instructions:  Weathering and erosion wear a landscape and build sedimentary layers. A. Sandstone layers are built as sand is deposited and buried by new sand, and the result is visible on mountains. B. Limestone layers are laid down when calcium carbide, an inorganic compound, falls out of solution and settles on limestone. C. Organic material, such as dinosaur fossils, lichen, and microbes, are preserved in shale. D. Quartz crystals are formed when feldspars are crystallized during the weathering of silicates and are deposited in the oceans.<n><n>### Dont forget to write your response for these examples and use each step correctly to demonstrate the different ways <n>you can complete and demonstrate the steps.<n><n>### Response<n>Write a response that demonstrates the different commands of python.<n><n>### The commands you will use in your response are:  print(variable name), or  print("variable name")<n><n>### The output of the program will be: the <n><n>### response that the command prompt will give you to finish the lesson. <n>

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What area is likely to contain a large village? Choices:  A: rural area B: big city C: suburbs D: ohio E: countryside<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>There's a large village in Ohio.<n><n>### Input, part two: The village has 23 farmers, 7 artists, 8 bakers and 16 clowns. What percentage of these people are artists?<n><n>### Response, part two:<n><n>33% of the villagers are artists, bakers or farmers.<n><n>### Reviewers who complete the task will be scored.<n><n>Reviewers who complete the task must answer the question, "What percentage of these people are artsits?" correctly. <n><n>The answer can either be correct percentage or a "N/A" or nil because the answer is not displayed. Reviewers who fail to provide a correct answer will have their score set to "Not complete", which will prevent them from advancing to the next task.<n><n>The task must be completed in 24 hours.<n><n>### A score may be assigned.<n><n>- 100  =  Completed<n>- 99  =  Complete<n>- 98 =  Incomplete<n>- 97 =  Not complete<n><n>### Ranges<n><n>  -1 -  99 =  Completed  =  Not completed<n>

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon. Choices:  A: book B: meeting C: television D: guide E: newspaper<n><n>### Response:		The choices are Books, Television, Meetings, Newspaper, and Guides. Which choices are options? Let the variable represent the correct answer. If the variable is more than the choices we have to eliminate some options. After elimination, how many options does the variable have?<n><n>### Output:<n>Books can only have one option. We can delete TV as an option because the answer and the options will not have a variable.<n>TV can have more than one option and the answer can have more than one too<n>Meetings can have multiple choice of answer with only one option.<n>Newspapers can have multiple choices of answer and the answer can have multiple too<n>Guides can only have one option that is the answer. Guides cannot have multiple choice of answer and the answer cannot have more than one too.<n><n>### Output 1:<n>Books: One option<n><n>##### What is option?<n>There is one choice.<n><n>##### Delete an option.<n>TV: more than one option<n><n>##### Remove it.<n><n>##### Choose the answer and the option.<n>Meetings: more than one option and more than one answer<n><n>##### Guides: Only one choice that is the answer<n><n>##### Choices: One choice<n>##### Choice:<n><n>### Output1: One choice<n>###### Delete and check the answer to the delete choice.<n><n>### Input2 <n>  > Input2:How will each option eliminate the other on Input2?<n>### Output 3:<n>The options on Input2 are the same as on Input1 and the answer on Input3 is a different.<n>  > Output3: There are three choices. The variable is more than the three choices we have, so we have to eliminate some choices. Which choices are eliminated?<n>  > Response: The choices eliminated is TV because it has one too many choice of options and one too many choices of answer. Meetings because of the same reason, one too many choice of answer and one too many option.  Guides cannot be eliminated because it only has one choice. Thus, it has a variable and a single choice. There are no other choices so the answer is variable, there are only answers without the variable.<n><n>### Question:Answer the following multiple response question.<n><n>If some of the letters in the previous question were incorrect, then the

He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:How might compassionate thoughful be described as being? Choices:  A: disengenious B: human C: weird D: kind E: stupid<n><n>### Response:		I believe that compassionate thoughtfulness can be described as kind. If you do this then you are being compassionate and at the same time you would be thoughtful by helping people in any way possible...<n><n><n>### Input : How far will you have gone if you walked at the same rate for 20 minutes and for the first half of an hour? Choices: <n><n>A: twice as far B: three times as far C: the same amount <n><n>### Response :A. I believe that if you walked at the exact rate for 20 mins and then walked at a half or 30 mins at a half that you would be going twice as far. I would say this because you would have twice the minutes to your walk in each of the cases and I believe that this would cause you to go twice the distance. This is why this statement is true.<n><n>### Input  : Which statement is true about 6 + 6 = 6?<n><n>A. 6 + 6 has an answer of 6.<n><n>B. 6 + 4 = 6<n><n>### Response  :C. Write an instruction that describes how to use the statement to solve the problem.<n><n>### Statement: <n>Let M, N and P be consecutive integers such that n≥2 and 2M+N<7.<n><n>### Direction:<n>Fill in the blanks.<n><n>### Solution:<n>5 M + 3 N = 9<n>12 M + 2 N = 8<n><n>### Instructions:Complete part (a) and (b).<n><n>### Statements:<n>1) If the given set S contains exactly the numbers 1, 3, 5, 7 and 9, which of the following correctly lists the numbers in ascending order?<n><n>Statement 1: 7, 9, 5, 3, 1<n><n>Statement 2: 9, 7, 5, 1, 3<n>A. Statements 1 and 2<n><n>### Statment 2<n><n>#### Explanation Statement 2<n>B. Statements 1 only<n>### Statements 3 and 4<n><n>### Statments 5 and 6<n><n>### Explanation The given set S contains exactly \([{1},{3},{5},{7},{9}]\).  <n><n>Let $a$ be the element in set S that represents $1$. Thus, we have<n>$1 \equiv 1$ (mod $3$). Since 2 divides 1, $2 \mid 1$. But 2 doesn't divide any member of the given set except for $1$. Thus $2 \nmid 3, 5 \ldots 9$. Therefore, $2$ is a divisor of $1$ and \strong{not} for any other member of the given set. <n><n>Based on what we know about the order of prime factors, we can conclude that $3, 5, \ldots 7$ are coprime. And $8 \nmid 3$. Since the greatest prime factor of $8$ is 2, $8$ is coprime with all positive integers.<n><n>Hence the correct answer would be $9, 7,6, 3, 2$<n>#### Note:<n>```<n>If one element of a set

Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:The friends loved competing against one another, it was a good way to work their what? Choices:  A: drawer B: filing cabinet C: computers D: desk E: filing cabinet<n><n>### Response:		 <n>> A<n><n>### Inputs:How much less money does a new $400 suit cost than a jacket that costs twice as much?<n><n>### Response<n>> $20<n><n>### Input<n>>Alice baked some cookies. She ate 7/8 of them.  She gave a half gallon of ice cream to her boyfriend Sam.  Then she gave 2/5 of a quarter gallon of ice crea...<n><n>### Response.<n>> There are 4 quarter gallons in a gallon<n><n>### Input.<n>> A bird eats 8 berries a day. Jack has 5 birds.  How many berries do Jack's birds eat in one day?<n><n>### response<n>> There are  4 days in a week.<n><n>### Input; <n>> A man spends 3/5 of his income on the first week of every year.  He spends 6/9 of the rest of his income during the rest of the year.  He has a total of...<n><n>### Response; <n>> Income is $100<n><n>1. The man starts the year with $50 and ends with $41<n><n>2. spends $50 * 25<n><n>3. spends the rest on 7 days * 19 days = 133 days.<n>

Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: medicine chest C: armpits D: grocery store E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Explanation:<n>```python<n>    answer = 0<n>      if answer == A:<n>        answer = 'E'<n>      elif answer == B:<n>        answer ='A'<n>      elif answer== C:<n>          answer ='B'<n>      elif answer = D:<n>          answer = 'C'<n>      elif answer=E:<n>          answer =  'D'<n>```<n>### Reference:<n>https://education.microsoft.com/en-gb/content/languages/python/beginners/lessons/lesson3.aspx<n><n>

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What prevents someone from getting sleep at night? Choices:  A: relax B: dreams C: have nightmares D: restlessness E: snore<n><n>### Response:		Choices: Choices: A, B, D, E Answer: A<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Input<n>Input: In a town, there were 12 bakery cranks. The bakery cranked twice as many doughnuts as chocolate rolls. If the total number of rolls and doughnuts was 300, how many chocolate rolls have been cranked in the town bakery?<n><n>### Response<n>The number of chocolate rolls that were cranked in the bakery was 57<n><n>#### Task: Answer the second question.<n>#### Demonstration: See how to solve by watching the video.<n><n>### Input 2<n>Input: In a superstore, there were a hundred 20 liter cartons of soy milk. However, that supermarket, after selling all the imported soy milk in a day, did not return the rest of the cartons back to the superstore. Which means, in other words, in the superstore, there were now 80 cartons less. The store also sold another 40 cartons of regular non-imported soy milk to a juice shop. The juice shop, in turn, bought 50 cartons of regular soy milk from a different superstore and returned 42 cartons that very night to the original superstore. How many cartons of soy drink does the original superstore still have?<n><n>#### Response 2<n>The remaining carton of soy milk in the super store is 16.<n><n>### Response 3<n><n>### Task: Write a function that takes in an array of any integer numbers(1,2,0,4 and -2) and a target number(4) and returns a boolean (true or false) based on if the array meets the target or not.<n><n>### For Example<n>```sh<n>for((i=0;i<=10;i++)){<n>for((j=0;j<=25;j++)){<n>sum=0;<n>for((k=0;k<=5;

Write each response in any logical, sensible, and organized manner.<n><n>### Input<n>Dear Dora,<n>Do I have your attention?<n><n>The way you asked these questions made my brain hurt a little. Here's what I wrote on M&Ms, and here's how it all works:<n><n>Let's go with the simplest example:<n>A, B, and C are all given to Penelope.<n>Penelope takes all A and half of B to make her own batch of m&m candies. Since A and B were only given all together, there's now (B - A) left over for her to m&m. That's half of B.<n>Now she still has (A/3 of C), which is the amount of m&m made to m&m a carrot. So she takes that amount of m&m and (A/3) to make her batch of carrots.<n>Then she's left (A - (B - A) + (A/3) - (A/3) = A - B + B/3. But B is equal to A, so it's A - A which is equal to 0, which means she's only left with those carrot she made.<n>The answer is therefore: A - B<n><n>### Output<n><n>That's how easy it is to make m&m candies for yourself.<n><n>### Signoff<n>I love you. You know I think our conversations need work. You know I'm still upset about it.<n>

He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What do you need to run after ball? Choices:  A: get tired B: have legs C: skip D: not fat E: look first<n><n>### Response:		B<n>

Choices:  A: candy store B: butcher shop C: kitchen D: auto repair shop E: post office<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input:<n>B<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The answer B indicates that it is at the butcher shop, not an auto repair shop or a grocery store.<n><n>### Input<n>How many apples were left unsold? How many were sold?<n><n>### Response<n>Input:<n>3.4<n><n>### Explantion:<n>Since the answer 3.4 means that three-point four apples have been sold and we divide the answer by four, which leaves us with a little bit of four. <n><n>### Input <n>A cashier at a grocery store had a day where many people came and asked for 232 coins, each of which weighs 343 grams. They want to make two groups of all the coins and put them in two different bags. What is the cost?<n><n>### Exlanation:<n>There is only 232 coinsthat they want to put into 2 bags. If they put 116 coins together and put them on one bag, how many coins are left? Is it 0? No. It is 116. 116 is greater than 0. So 116 could be put into the second bag. If they put 66 coinstogether, they only have 76 left. There are only 76 coins, divided among two groups. To put into two groups, divide the 76 coins by two. The answer that came out is 38 coins. There are 2 bags left, each one has 38 coins total. So it costs 76/2, which is equal to 38.<n><n>### Examples with real world applications<n>(examples of how the skill is used in real-world contexts and in the workplace; if there is one, explain why these applications and situations in particular are relevant)<n>* An example of this skill would be if a worker needs to do an audit on a project and sees that he has 68% of the work finished. He knows he needs to find the exact amount he needs to do to make it at 100%. <n>* Also, a relevant example would be a manager needing to know how much money is left on the floor counter if a clerk says someone bought two l

Its economy thrived, its foreign policy was strong, and its military influence was unmatched.<n><n>#### Choices:<n>1. ______<n>2. ______<n>3. ______<n>4. ______<n><n>#### Answer<n><n>3. dominant<n><n>### Task A<n><n>Below is a statement. There are then several choice options. After choosing the appropriate answer, write a response. In response, write an appropriate word or phrase for the blank. Each of the options represents a grammatical change.<n><n>The U.S. economy has increased by more than 15%.<n><n>#### Choices<n>1. It is expected to increase 5% from the prior year by the last quarter of ______.<n>2. The U.S. economy was flat last month and is more than ______ from 6 months ago.<n>3. Over the last 30 days, the U.S. economy is up ______ year over year.<n>4. Last year, the U.S economy grew by slightly more in growth ______.<n><n>#### Answer<n>3. percent<n>

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What does a judge do when someone is convicted of a crime? The number of people using cars is 62  less than 3 times the number of people arrivuring by train. <n><n>The total number of people who walked or rode bicycles was 20% greater than the total number of people leaving.<n><n>The number of skateboards used was 60 fewer than the number of bicycles used, while the number of handcars was 20 less than twice the number of cars that arrived on handcars, bicycles, and skateboards, combined.<n><n>### Response :<n><n>### Input & Output :<n><n>What is the population of the country?<n><n>### Response & Output :<n><n>How many cars, bikes, handcars and skateboards can one person drive?<n><n>### Input<n>The number is 178. <n><n>### Response<n>The number is 78.<n><n><n>### Input <n>There are 1,013 cows, of which there are 3 times as boys as girls. He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:In war, your primary method is combat, but your goal is to do what? Choices:  A: conquer opponent B: fight enemy C: join army D: kill E: terrible<n><n>### Response:		D: terrible<n><n>## Examples<n><n>### Example 1:<n><n><n>We need only write what is in the picture, but the picture is not correct. <n><n>### Challenge:<n><n>The last two boxes are the same.<n><n>### Challenge challenge:<n><n>The last block is the same.<n><n><n>---<n>## References<n><n>### Reference<n>[Puzzle](https://www.reddit.com/r/learnprogramming/comments/67f6sj/write_a_program_to_answer_a_math_question/)

How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where would you read a passage but not write it? Choices:  A: diary B: city C: bible D: graffiti E: labyrinth<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is D graffiti.<n><n>### Input:-9 = 3 x -3<n><n>### Response:-9 = 3<n><n>### Input (A):48 + 36 = 60<n><n>### Response (A):48 = 36 - 14<n><n>```ruby<n>input_1 = 'x = 48'<n>input_2 = '18'<n><n>puts input_1.remove('=').to_i.to_s<n># => 48<n><n>puts input1<n># => x = 48<n><n>input1.to_i<n># => 44<n>```<n><n>```java<n>public static void main(String[] args) {<n>    Integer ia = 12;<n>    ia += 4;<n>    System.out.println("The sum of 12 is " + ia);<n>}<n>```<n><n>```ruby<n>(1..5).to_a.map { |n| n * (2..5).to_map.map { |i,j| i * j }.max_by { |_,a| a } }<n># => [24]<n>```<n><n>```c#<n>using System;<n><n>class Program<n>{<n>    static void Main(string[] args)<n>    {<n>        var sum = 12 * (2..5) * (2..5);<n>        var max = sum.Where(x => x >= 0);<n>        WriteLine(max.Min(x => x.Value));<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n>

Then, a student should brainstorm based on the question and decide on the steps to be taken to solve the task. The next step is to analyze the question more deeply and decide which answer choice is correct if more than one. Finally, the student must decide the appropriate response choice from the answer choices given. A student should use the writing tips in the rubric to achieve higher grades. <n><n>### Write the appropriate response:<n><n>Instructions:<n>In the below table, you will see a series of numbers connected together through mathematical operations. Each number will provide you with your next target number. Using these given target numbers, and the given mathematical operations, construct your response.<n><n>**Operations**<n><n>Sum: (+)<n><n>Subtract: (-)<n><n>Multiply: (x)<n><n>Divide: (/)<n><n>### Input1<n><n>**1429 + 537**<n><n>2463 + 37 + 537 (sum) **=**<n><n>**731**<n><n>**7**3 (sum)<n><n>**37**3 + **537**3 (subtract)<n><n>**128 + 221**<n><n>**349**<n><n>**3**4 - **4**9 (subtract) **=**<n>```<n><n>**0**8<n><n>**143**<n><n>**37 + 549**<n><n>```<n><n>1500 / 11<n><n>```<n><n>**137**<n><n>753 **=**<n>```

After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Why shouldn't you walk barefooted after the rain? If a customer buys five books, the total they pay to the cashier depends on what they buy.<n><n>Answer: The customer will pay $110.<n><n>Input: For the same situation, if the customer buys three books, the total they will pay the cashier will probably be more than $70. Which of the following reasons might help them figure out how much to pay the cashier?<n><n>SOLUTION:<n><n>A1.The total payment for $30 is greater than the total payment for $20.<n><n>B1.For every five $10 books, there are 15 $10 books. The $10 books make up half of the books that cost less than $20.<n>

Choices:  A: jungle B: bamboo grove C: australian outback D: china E: child's book<n><n>### Response:		Answer E, child's book<n><br><n>The museum made an odd decision to put the stuffed creature where you normally see a panda.<n><br><n>While pandas do roam the grasslands in China, what do koalas do?<n><br><n>Koalas are Australian marsupials with a strange diet of only eucalyptus leaves (not bamboo like pandas).<n><br><n>When we go to the zoo, we normally see a collection of pandas and other interesting creatures all in one place. <n><br><n>If we found anything other than pandas, we'd probably be confused, because nothing in the room would make us think of China.<n><br>

Choices:  A: school children B: parents C: get money D: require to pay taxes E: take money<n><n>### Response:		<n>> A<n><n>### Input : Where do you usually get your food? Choices: <n><n>### Demoscene: <n><n>## Question 4<n><n>### Subquestion: Write a function to solve the given problem.<n><n>### Question: Write a function called `sum` that takes in a collection of integers and finds their sum.<n><n>### Subresponse: Your function should return an integer which is the sum of the numbers in the input. If you're having trouble solving this question, you should check out the section labeled "`Arrays and Sums`" in the class notes.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>Input a collection to find the sum of its elements:<n>```<n>>>> sum([1, 2, 3])<n>```<n>```<n>Returns:<n>```<n>>>4<n>```<n><n>## Question 5<n><n>### Sub question : <n><n>## Demonstration: <n><n>## Respose: <n><n>## Subquestion:<n><n>### SubResponse:<n><n>```<n>>>> def sum(x):<n>...   return sum([x + y for y in range(0,i+1)])<n>...<n>...<n>>>> x5 = sum(5)<n>...<n>40 <n>```<n><n>### SubQuestion 3:<n><n>### Response3:<n>```<n>>>x6 40>>> x6 63<n>>>> x6 72<n>72>>>>x6 96<n><n>96>>>> x7 960<n>960>>>x11 9000<n><n>9000>>>x15 22844<n>065608910<n>>>> x16 30884<n>30884.000000<n>0656233520828.00<n>>>> x20 31676<n>31676.0<n>```<n>### Subquestion 4:<n><n>### Demo: <n>```<n>>>> x1 > x7<n>>> True<n>>>> x1 < x11<n>>> True<n>>> x1 > x16<n>>> True<n>>>x11>x20<n>>> True<n>```<n>

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:He finally found someone as ugly as him, knowing he wouldn't be the one sticking out was what? Can you tell me how I can do this?<n><n>### Response:# If I add 1,000 to 500 I get 1,500. This is the difference between 2,50 and 1,00, which is 1,00. I then divide the difference (2,500 - 1,00) by the difference between 1, and 5 (500 - 20).<n><n>### Input2:#A.24<n>### Response:24<n>### Input3:#A.4<n>### Response.A.Four<n>### For the following word problems, solve for the unknown variable. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Who designs a building? Choices:  A: jewelry store B: case C: hock D: watch store E: pawn<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* Option A:<n><n>    The options in that question are:<n>        `A: jewelry Store`<n>        `B: Watch Store`<n>        `C: Pawn Shop`<n>        `D: Watch store`<n><n>It is hard to distinguish from each other but that man was trying to sell that watch for cash or you can also say as a cash deal for drug money. So the answer is option b.<n><n>    The man on the street corner tried to sell his watch for cash as a drug money, so the best answer is `B: hock.`<n><n>* Option B:<n>In option b, we can say the man was trying to hock that watch for drug money as the options are:<n>    `A: jeweler's store`<n>    `B: hock`<n>    `C: case`<n>    `D: Watch Store`<n>Hock is the synonym for Pawn. So, the actual meaning of the sentence in the option is a man trying to sell a watch as drug money as he wanted cash. So option b is correct.<n><n>* Option C:<n><n>    This option has been given as `C: Pawn shop.` And it is not a correct answer because Hock will be a Pawn<n><n>* Option D:<n>This option is `D: Watch Store.` And this is also incorrect as this means someone who wants cash for watch.<n><n>### Input<n>The man on the street who tried to show a watch was trying to what it as drug money?<n><n>Output:<n><n>> Option A: Watch Store is correct<n><n>### Instructor's Feedback:How did you answer this question? If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. Write your own solution for the task.<n><n>### Task:<n>You're hired to make a cake for a dinner party, and your boss asks you to write a script for a scripting program to tell how many servings your cake will yield. There will be a number of guest, and for each guest you'll write the number of servings for each of the following categories:<n>- cake, in cake servings<n>- ice-cream cake slice, in ice cream cake slice servings<n>- ice cream sandwich, in ice cream sandwich servings<n>- cupcakes, in cupcake servings<n><n>Write a script that determines how many servings you'll make.<n><n>### Solution:<n>There are 6 slices of pie, 4 pound cake, 14 cupcakes, and 3 ice cream sandwiches.<n><n>The script will be:<n><n>number of slices of pie * 1<n><n>number of pounds of cake * 1<n><n>14 and<n><n>number of cupcakes * 1<n><n>3 and<n><n>number of ice cream sandwich * 1<n><n>The total servings is 15 * 1 + 14 * 1 +

How much did Rory needed for her college tuition?<n>Answer: She needs $940<n>### Solution: $900 + $40 => $940<n>

Choices:  A: neighborhood B: subdivision C: city D: suburbs E: street<n><n>### Response:		Neighborhood<n><n>### Input (Hook):Jordana was a 41 year old woman who had a family to take care of. She worked in a company that paid her $210.00 a week. She was a very smart woman who has a bachelors degree in business administration, but she worked as a cashier in a local deli. Everyday she would go home and look for a job in the newspaper for another source of income. She looked online and there were a lot of positions for people who didn't have a high school diploma and not much education. One day she heard an ad on radio about a job in a call center that paid $22.00 an hour. She got all the information and saw that they even helped her prepare for the interview. Jordana went to the place the next day and the lady on the other side of the table was surprised...<n><n>### Response (Body): Jordana was a 40 year old woman who had no family to take care of that she knew of. She also didn't work in a company that paid $210 and she doesn't have any kind of college degree or diploma. Somehow she didn't think she was smart; however, she knew that because of her lack of knowledge and intelligence, she found it quite difficult to find a job that's why she was looking online. She was looking for a way to earn some extra money because she was thinking about buying a house for her family that would be very safe and gated. One day she heard about a job that pay $22 an hour in the radio so she decided to go to that place as soon as possible. So that day, she went to that place to try to get the job that she had found in the radio.<n><n>### Response End:<n>She was amazed when the other side of the desk smiled and said that she is hired to work at that place. She felt so happy for that moment. She left crying that day with two children who were very happy because soon they would have a safe home.<n><n>### Input 1:If you can use a spoon to eat cereal, but you can also eat cereal with a fork. Choices:  A: headache B: understand themselves C: compliments D: own house E: happiness<n><n>### Response:		<n>If we are talking about a grumpy person, they are not likely to have happiness. They might be having headache or understanding themselves.<n><n>### Input<n>Josh likes ice cream. He eats 1/5 of a tub of ice cream each day. In two weeks he has eaten a whole tub.  He wants to know how many people he could feed.  Is there enough ice cream for 200 people?<n><n>### Response<n>I would check and see how many people he has in order to feed that many.  So lets say he has 100 people. 5/100 x 200 = 100 / 5th tube of ice cream.  Josh would need to have 20 tubs of ice cream to feed the amount of people he would like.  So answer would be no he does not have enough ice cream to feed 200 people.<n><n>

How long is the road we need to build?<n>> 7.5 miles<n><n><hr>  <n><n>What is the answer to the above problem?<n>> 14 miles<n><n><hr>. > <n><n>What will happen after we start at 14 miles?<n>> Start at 14 miles (we started 6.5 miles down, making our "end") and ending at 12.5 miles (we started at 6.5 miles away)<n><n>### Answer:<n>Le

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What is someone who gets angry after getting drunk likely to participate in? Choices:  A: violence B: falling down C: vomiting D: vomiting E: lower standards<n><n>### Response:		C or D<n><n>### Instructions: Answer each of the questions by choosing one word or phrase from each pair of words and joining the two to make a single word.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>### Instructor:<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>### Question #1:<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Example Answer:<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>## Question #2:<n><n>## Demonstration:

How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. Choices:  A: launch pad B: circus C: aircraft carrier D: large open area E: space station<n><n>### Response:		The answer is C.A circus carrier could be used as a launch pad for space shuttles to go into space. A.launch pad could be used to launch a jet. B. a aircraft carriers and a aircraft carrier could be used to launch aircraft and ships. D. a land based space station is not mobile. And an open area is not mobile.<n><n>### Input : If the surface area of the triangle below is 42 square inches, then what is the perimeter? Choices: A: 12 B: 16 C: 14 D: 18 E: 20<n><n>### Response : The answer is D. The perimeter of an equilateral triangle must equal 3 times the measures of a side to equal 3. The Pythagorean Theorem states a^2 + b^2 = c^2. a = 4 in this exercise because the area of the triangle is 42, b = 3 because each side of the triangle is the same length, and c = 5 in this exercise because all angles of an equilateralted triangle must be equal.<n><n>###  Input: A farmer has 5 sheep and 2 cows. How many feet does he have?<n><n>### Response  : The farmer has 7 feet, two of them feet from each sheep and four of them from each cow<n><n>### Input  :  In a row, there are 4 people and twice as many people after the second person. How many people in the row?<n><n>###  Response : There are 9 people in the row: The first person's spot is filled by 1, The second spot is filled by 2, The third spot is filled by 4, The fourth spot is filled by 8, and the fifth and sixth slots are filled by two more people each equal to the first spot. It takes two people to fill each slot of the row, so the seventh and eighth spots are filled by only one person and the ninth spot is unfilled.

To get  288, multiply any pair of multiples that are 2x higher and 2x lower: 2x(2x)=  243 x  2= 486. The  2x(2x) =   LCM of 36 & 46= 288<n><n>### Input    : There exists at least one common factor of 70, 26, and 28.<n><n>###Response   :   <n>There are two common factors of 26 and 28 = 1, 7. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where is a fox likely to be caught? Choices:  A: tennessee B: inside joke C: grassy field D: the forrest E: england<n><n>### Response:		E, in england, a fox's habitat are more likely<n>

Choices:  A: agreement B: to fill their time C: discomfort D: misunderstanding E: learning about<n><n>### Response:		Chatting is a learning process and people learn through interaction and conversation. Discomfort and agreement are not significant in learning. Learning is about filling gaps in conversation and this is done when we interact with friends using words or in this case, text.

After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Janet knew she was dying from her injuries because she could feel herself doing what? Choices:  A: sleeping longer B: getting cold C: death and decay D: change of color E: stop breathing<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>D<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>Choice E: stop breathing, in other words Janet is gone; Janet can see she is dying in her mind and starts to leave her body. <n>

Choices: A: $16.6667+2.7320$ B: $(18/13)+(2/2\sqrt[2]{8})$ C: $2\sqrt{8/2^3}+2/13$ D: $(18/5)+((13/18)\sqrt{5})$ E: $4/13 +((18/13)\sqrt[2]{8}$<n><n>### Response :None of these.<n><n>Input:Which of the following statements is equivalent to $16+4 \sqrt{11}$?<n><n>Choices: A: $4 \sqrt{10}$ B: $17 $ C: $4 \sqrt[4]{11}$ D: $19 $ E: $20\sqrt{11}$<n><n>I tried to substitute the variables for the expression:<n><n>$14-4 \sqrt{14}$<n><n>And after dividing each of them by 14, we get this:<n><n>$1\frac{13}{14}-\sqrt{7}$<n><n>But when I got to the square root, it said 13 /14 was irrational.<n><n>I thought it over but then I realized that I was just trying to simplify using the method of substitution, but all the variables did not come out even at the same number.<n><n>I also realized after trying it several times that there is no rational root that I can substitute within the solution to the cube root and the square root that we were looking at.<n><n>
