"I have to be good at speaking English."<n><n>### Response2:C<n><n>### Input3:Which choice means the same as the other in the meaning of what the speaker says? You walk by the house that is for sale.<n><n>### Responce3:D<n><n>## Explanation:Answer 1:D, The first statement is informal and the second is formal.<n><n>Answer 2:D, Need is more polite than must.<n><n>Answer 3:C, All choices mean "walking buy a person selling a home".<n><n><n># Coding<n><n># Questions on Code<n><n>### Task 2<n>(Python)<n>Input: 9 7 3 9 8 3 0 2 0 9 0 1 0<n><n>### Result: Output<n>100<n><n>### Task<n>Your task is to write a code

They eat food at tables."<n><n>### Input<n>When a question asks for a sentence the response could be a different sentence, answer, or short phrase. You must write an appropriate response for a task or question.<n><n>## Input: Pete walked 2 from his house to the house by 5 blocks to the bus garage. He rode the bus to to post office to get some postage to get stamps later. How many blocks did him walk in in all?<n><n>### Response<n><n>## Demostration: The response can be, "In total he walked 5 blocks."<n><n>### Demand:Pete walked 5 blocks to the house by 2 blocks.<n><n>##### Instruction:<n>Write a response that appropriately uses the correct preposition before an action verb in a given sentence.<n><n>## Input<n>When a question requires you to use an infinitive with a specific preposition you must provide the preposition and infinitive in your response. If you pick the wrong preposition or use the wrong infinitive you will miss the point of the question or the task will not make sense.<n><n>## Demostartion<n><n>### Input "If I were at all more ambitious, I would start my own business."<n><n>### Response "If I were ambitious at all"<n><n>### Demstraction: The response should read, "If I were any more ambitious, at all, I would start my business." The writer can not use ambitious twice like "If I were am" this means something else. The speaker is saying that they are not ambitious at all, they are not even slightly ambitious.<n><n>## Input"I wonder if it will rain again tomorrow."<n><n>### Instructions: Write a response that appropriates the word tense in that sentence.<n><n>## Demonstration<n><n>### Response 1. "I wonder if it will will rain again" The subject is if that would be in future tense.<n><n>### Response2. "I wonder if tomorrow it will rain

I looked at my thermostat and it read -20. When I stepped outside, snow began falling to my chest. It was so cold that I couldn't make it very far because I had to cover all of my body so that I wouldn't get too cold. When I finally made it to my car in the street, I realized I had eaten enough snacks throughout the day to fulfill an entire day's caloric requirements. It was cold.<n><n>### Challenge Task:  <n><n>## Challenge Response  <n><n>## Output:<n><n>### Input1: 1. He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where can you get a stray small dog? Choices:  A: living room B: animal shelter C: georgia D: pet shop E: dog show<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n><img src="../assets/images/image-20210103235429867.png" alt="response" />  <n><n>#### Response<n>Choices:<n>A: living room<n>B: animal shelter<n>C: georgia<n>D: pet shop<n>E: dog show<n>The place to get a stray small dogs is D<n><n># Day 3<n><n>### Instructions: In this problem, you will have to look at the problem and see how many of the given statements (claims) in a problem hold true and use that information to make conclusions for later problems.<n><n>Write one sentence that answers the following question: “Would you get married in this town?” Choose one of the following reasons why someone would leave the town. Use your answer to help identify why someone might move to the town instead. Then find the sum of the ages of the men and the sum of the ages for the women. Which of the following is not true:<n><n>- The sum of these ages is even<n>- The sum of the ages of men is two less than the sum of women’s ages<n>The sum of the ages of women is larger than the sum of the ages on the men.<n>- There are more women than men.<n><n>### Explanation: In this question, you have to find out if the statement is true or false.<n><n>I would not get married in this town because it would be hard to find dates (single people).<n><n>- The sum is not even and it has 64 people that live in the town.<n><n>### How can you reason?<n><n>- If I am a widower (or single) in the town then I would be easier to find some people to come out with me.<n><n>### Extra Challenge<n>Write one sentence that describes why someone would stay in this town.<n><n>- It is a beautiful town<n><n>Write one sentence to explain why you think a cow would be a good pet for a woman living in this town.<n>The woman’s name is Anna and the cow can be her companion and it is not as loud as a horse<n><n>### Day 4<n><n>### Add Two Numbers. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What creatures performing pollination are loved my millions? Choices:  A: birds B: action C: butterflies D: happiness E: anxiety<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is B<n>

Choices:  A: get to know B: gain knowledge C: intelligence D: education E: gaining knowledge<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>There are many reasons to pursue higher education to gain knowledge. The main goal of higher education is to acquire knowledge and skills. The main purpose of higher education is to increase one's understanding and knowledge of a specific topic.<n><n>In higher education, students typically have the opportunity to interact with faculty and other students. Furthermore, college students learn more as a result of interacting with faculty/peers. Higher education institutions also support intellectual advancement.<n><n><n>In higher education students have a lot of advantages, such as:<n><n>-  More social interaction with other people<n>- Learn new skills<n>- Discover new interests<n>- Expand vocabulary<n>- Gain more independence<n>- Ability to express emotions<n>- Build strong relationships<n><n>By the way when you're having education you will get knowledge, not just books knowledge, but also practical knowledge, to prepare you for an unknown future.<n><n>---<n>### Note:If you want to understand more about the answer in more depth please refer to the following websites<n><n>- [1/](https://www.buzzfeed.com/stephaniemlee/college-students-explain-why-education-is-worth-it<n>- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Education<n>- [3/](https://higherlogicdownload.s3.amazonaws.com/CEA5786399/cea/13895764-D7C6-380E-723A-8EBAEE6C3986/Why do people go to college.pdf<n>- http://www.thecollegeboard.org/the-road-to-college<n>

Choices:  A: actions B: legal C: authentic D: logical E: legitimate<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question with a statement.<n><n>### Solution: I would purchase a designer handbag from a legitimate store because the authenticity and quality of the product should be guaranteed. Otherwise, I will not be able to trust the product's quality, and I may purchase an imitation.

How much was Erik left with?<n><n>### Input- Solution<n>Erik was left with $362<n><n>### Instuctions<n>Tell me the next two math equations in order.<n><n>## Instructions<n>The sum of $18, 23, 29, 35, …200 …209 gives a sum of what number? Give your answer without a comma.<n><n>## Solution<n>The sum of the $18, 34, 45, 58, 67, 78, 88, 99, 101, and 109 gives the sum of 1159<n><n>### Instructios- Answer<n>The multiplication of $3, 4, 25, and 28 gives a number of 45

If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where does a marmoset not usually go? Choices:  A: dictionary B: wilderness C: fly D: underground E: colorado<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Input : A bird must be on a mountain to fly and  on the ground to hunt, but she does not want to be on  either one alone. Where should she go?<n><n>### Choice: A: sea B: lake C: cave D: ocean E: swamp<n><n>### Response :<n>B<n><n>### Input<n>Winter and Misha are playing with a balloon. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:She was processing the wool, she kept her leg bouncing to operate the what? Choices:  A: charming B: space shuttle C: house D: train station E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		Space Shuttle<n><n>### Explanation:<n>* Space shuttles recycle air after it passes through the air filtering system, which removes the pathogens and dirt. The air filtering system is important in a space shuttle, because astronauts are exposed to many harmful pathogens inside.<n><n>### Input : You can eat 90 calories for every 6 oz. of food, but you can only eat 76 oz. of carrots in a week, and 25 oz. of lettuce a week. How many calories can you eat in one week?<n><n>### Response :10568244 calories<n><n>### Example : A man travels 23 km to buy gas and then travels 38 km to fill up the gas tank. How many kilometers does he travel to buy gas? How many kilometers does the man travel after he fills up his gas tank?<n><n>### Explation :<n>* 23 km – to go to buy gas<n>* 38 km – to fill up the gas<n>* Total traveled = (23+38)km = 61 km<n><n>### Input  :<n>* 22 cm + 4 cm + 2 cm =?  22 cm – 6 cm =<n><n>### Response  :<n>* 16 cm<n><n>### Input  <n>* A dog can swim in an ocean. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:A person would carry a large netted drawstring bag to what sort of place? Choices:  A: airport B: car C: jewelry store D: garbage can E: laundry room<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I don't think I am well versed on the kinds of places we go to, I've probably been to a few of the mentioned places. However, I do know of a place where we keep all sorts of items. Our kitchen.<n><n>So let me think; A is airport, which we do not carry a large bag. So we discount A.<n><n>Then comes in B. Well, I do know of many people who have large bags of clothes and other items in their cars.<n><n>But the one I know for sure has a netted, drawstring bag is D.<n><n>Therefore, option D  is the correct answer.<n>

Choices:  A: fatigue B: relaxation C: tiredness D: muscle weakness E: losing weight<n><n>### Response:		A: Fatigue is a word that is common in our modern language so for that we can go with that.<n><n>### Input:(Choices:  A: 51 minutes B: 13 minutes C: 26 minutes D: 12 minutes E: 16 minutes F: 18 minutes<n><n>### Response:(Please use the correct answer, I think this is a little confusing but the right answer is 45)<n><n>### Input (Choices: A: 94 hours B: 54 hours C: 74 hours D: 182 hours E: 23 hours F: 67 hours<n><n>### Answer (Please use the correct answer)<n><n>### ANSWER: B<n>#### Why:Because we have a total of six hours, since there are eight students, and 45 hours would only be 7 hours for the 4th hour which would make them run out of time.<n><n>### ASSUMPTIONS<n>* The number of students = 8<n>* The hours = (24 * 7)<n><n>### EXAMPLE:What time is this clock showing? If there are 8 students and 45 hours.<n>* (45/8) * 24<n>= 45/8 *24 = (9/8) * 7 = 1<n><n>### ANOTHER ASSUMPTION<n>

If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where do you wait in a reception area for a meeting? Choices:  A: hall B: motel C: hotels D: law firm E: office building<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**Answer**:<n>```python<n># Define an enum<n>class Location(Enum):<n>    # A: hall<n>    HALL = 'hall'<n>    # B: motel<n>    MOTEL ='motel'<n>    # C: hotels<n>    HOTELS = 'hotels'<n>    # D: law firm<n>    LAW_FIRM = 'law_firm'<n>    # E: office building<n>    OFFICE_BUILDING = 'office_building'<n><n>    def __init__(self, value):<n>        super().__init__(value)<n><n>def _parse_location(location):<n>        for loc, value in Location.value_map.items():<n>            if location == loc:<n>                return value<n>        return "invalid"<n><n>def _is_valid_location(location): # is it a valid location? (eg a name)<n>    try:<n>        return _parse_location(str(location))<n>    except Exception as e:<n>        return False<n><n>def parse_location(loc):<n>    # check validity of location<n>    if _is_valid_name(loc):<n>        return str(loc)<n>    '''Invalid location'''<n>    return 'invalid' + ', please enter value <n>    '''Invalid location '''<n><n>loc = _parse_location (input())<n>```<n><n>```python<n><n>def _isvalid_name(locations):<n>    if locations[0:5] == 'A':<n>        return True<n>    elif locations[0:8] == 'B':<n>        return True # motel is only 'B'<n>    elif locations[10:15] == 'C':<n>        return True   # hotels <n>    elif locations[6:9] == 'D':<n>        return True    # law firm<n>    elif locations[:11] == 'E':<n>        return True      # office buildings <n>    '''Invalid Location'''<n>    else:<n>        return False     <n><n>    def _get_number(locations, length):<n>        numbers = []<n>        for p in range(0, length):<n>            p -= 1<n>            numbers.append(locations[p])<n>        return numbers<n><n>    def _isValid(locations, length) : # given a number sequence, is it valid

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. If she has 25 M&M candies, how many Starbursts candies does she have?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:How would someone feel after going for run? The number of paragraphs required will vary. Check with your teacher for this information.<n><n>### Questions:You are organizing a debate as your part of a class assignment. You're the moderator for the debates and the topic is climate change. You have divided up your team in two groups and have picked the top three arguments from each group. You are going to start out by giving each side three minuets to present their arguments.<n><n>### Topic1:What do you hope they say that is true, and a valid point?<n><n>Your team has made strong arguments about deforestation. There has been a lot of deforestation over the last couple of years, and this will not stop unless people make a change to this. It takes years for a tree to grow to its original size, and once it is gone no one can fix it. If we plant trees, we will lessen the carbon footprint that the trees take up. They help to lessen global warming, they also help to give the animals habitats. So, if we all start getting onboard with the idea we can see how much better it is for the earth. But, deforestation is a global problem. If everyone gets on board it might take a while before we see the results we are all looking for<n><n>Your team has stated that we should be more careful over our waste, and use less energy around the home. We all know that energy is expensive, and the more we use the faster we are running out. We should be trying to conserve it, rather than waste it. If we did this, there would be more money to use for other necessities. Not everyone can afford gas, electricity, or water. If, we were more careful with the necessities the expense of them wouldn’t be as high.<n><n>The final topic for your side is fossil fuels are causing environmental changes and it’s our duty because we are the consumers and it should be taken out.<n><n>### Point1: What do you hope they say, that they do not actually mean?<n><n>One of my least favorite topics is climate change. I don't understand why this is

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>Input: Penelope has 5 M&M candies for every 3 Starbursts candies. They are in various shapes and colors. There is also birds in the zoo and they sing some beautiful songs. Some people think that zoo is not a good place for the animals because they are caged.
